name: SupplierCreatePurchaseOrder
auth_description: Requires a user of type `Employee` or `Api` with functionality `ThirdPartyCreatePurchaseOrder:None`

headers.name: EVA-User-Agent
headers.description: The user agent that is making these calls. Don't make this specific per device/browser but per application. This should be of the form: `MyFirstUserAgent/1.0.0`

headers.name: EVA-Requested-OrganizationUnitID
headers.description: The ID of the organization unit to run this request in.

headers.name: EVA-Requested-OrganizationUnit-Query
headers.description: The query that selects the organization unit to run this request in.

headers.name: EVA-IDs-Mode
headers.description: The IDs mode to run this request in. Currently only `ExternalIDs` is supported.

headers.name: EVA-IDs-BackendSystemID
headers.description: The ID of the backend system that is used to resolve the IDs.

request_samples.name: JSON
request_samples.sample:
{
  "BackendID": "string",
  "BackendSystemID": "string",
  "CopyBackendReferenceOnShip": true,
  "CustomFields": {
    "key": "any valid json value"
  },
  "ExpectedDeliveryDate": "2024-10-07",
  "Lines": [
    {
      "BackendReference": "string",
      "CurrencyID": "string",
      "ExpectedDeliveryDate": "2024-10-07",
      "ProductID": 123,
      "Quantity": 123,
      "UnitPrice": 123.456
    }
  ],
  "Receive": true,
  "Ship": true,
  "ShipFromOrganizationUnitID": 123,
  "ShipToOrganizationUnitID": 123,
  "ShipmentBackendID": "string"
}

request_samples.name: CURL
request_samples.sample:
curl -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -H "EVA-User-Agent: MyFirstUserAgent/1.0.0" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer <token>" \
  --data '{
  "BackendID": "string",
  "BackendSystemID": "string",
  "CopyBackendReferenceOnShip": true,
  "CustomFields": {
    "key": "any valid json value"
  },
  "ExpectedDeliveryDate": "2024-10-07",
  "Lines": [
    {
      "BackendReference": "string",
      "CurrencyID": "string",
      "ExpectedDeliveryDate": "2024-10-07",
      "ProductID": 123,
      "Quantity": 123,
      "UnitPrice": 123.456
    }
  ],
  "Receive": true,
  "Ship": true,
  "ShipFromOrganizationUnitID": 123,
  "ShipToOrganizationUnitID": 123,
  "ShipmentBackendID": "string"
}' \
  https://euw.acme.test.eva-online.cloud/message/SupplierCreatePurchaseOrder

C.name: BackendReference
C.description: The BackendReference of the line to create

C.name: CurrencyID
C.description:
The currency of the unit price. If not supplied, the order's currency will be used. The UnitPrice will be converted to the order's currency. If no exchangerate is available, the UnitPrice will be ignored and the price is fetched from an available pricelist.

This is the ID of a `Currency`

C.name: ExpectedDeliveryDate
C.description: Date that the supplier expects to deliver this orderline. If you supply multiple lines with the same ProductID, we only take the latest date.

C.name: ProductID
C.description:
Identifier of the product

This is the ID of a `Product`

C.name: Quantity
C.description: Quantity that is expected to be shipped

B.name: BackendID
B.description: Identifier of the order from the 3rd party

B.name: BackendSystemID
B.description: Identifier of the 3rd party system that created the order

B.name: CopyBackendReferenceOnShip
B.description: Copy the orderlines backendreference to the shipmentlines backendreference, works only if `Ship` is set to true

B.name: ExpectedDeliveryDate
B.description: Date that the supplier expects to deliver the shipment(s) of the purchase order. Can also be specified on the line level. If specified on both levels, the line level will take precedence.

B.name: Lines
B.description:
Contents of the purchase order.
Note: Only one key property can be used to identify the product. When different properties are used, the request will be invalid.
This will become redundant when ProductID is the only property left.

B.name: Receive
B.description: Receive the order immediately after shipping, works only if `Ship` is set to true

B.name: Ship
B.description: Ship the order immediately after creation.

B.name: ShipFromOrganizationUnitID
B.description:
OrganizationUnit who will be supplying the stock.

This is the ID of a `OrganizationUnit`

B.name: ShipToOrganizationUnitID
B.description:
OrganizationUnit that will be receiving the purchase order shipment(s).

This is the ID of a `OrganizationUnit`

B.name: ShipmentBackendID
B.description: BackendID of the shipment to be created. Works only if `Ship` is set to true. Make sure this is unique.

E.name: Code
E.description: A unique ID identifying this error.

E.name: Message
E.description: A human-readable message describing the error.

E.name: RequestID
E.description: A unique ID identifying the request. Please provide this ID when contacting support.

E.name: Type
E.description: A short description of the error type.

F.name: ExternalIDs
F.description: When using the `ExternalIDs` mode, this will hold the resolved external IDs.

F.name: IsAsyncResultAvailable
F.description: This is a flag indicating whether the async request is done. If it is `null`, it is not an async service. If it is `false`, the response is not yet available. Do not process the properties in that case. It is is `true` the properties are filled with the result of the call.

F.name: UnresolvedExternalIDs
F.description: When using the `ExternalIDs` mode, this will hold the external IDs we couldn't resolve.

D.name: ID
D.description: This is the ID of a `Order`
